description: Early life essentials: basic school uniforms, casualwear, and shoes accumulated across childhood and teenage years. Mostly practical and worn long-term.
Adulthood begins: wardrobe expands with workwear, socialwear, seasonal pieces, and trend-driven purchases. Fast fashion enters regular rotation.
Lifestyle diversification: items pile up for work, leisure, sports, events, and parenting. Duplicates, gifts, and rarely worn pieces increase.
Peak accumulation: decades of buying, seasonal refreshes, and special-purpose items result in a wardrobe much larger than daily needs.
Slowed purchasing, but lifetime accumulation includes stored, forgotten, and unworn garments. The total footprint reflects a full consumption arc.
